title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and sets the output folder to a bin directory, the system does not prompt to confirm the deletion and rebuilding of the bin directory.
EB: When a user creates a new project, the system should prompt them to confirm the deletion and rebuilding of the bin directory if it is selected as the output folder.
SR:
1. Open the application
2. Click on 'Create New Project'
3. Select an existing directory structure
4. Set the output folder to a bin directory
5. Check if a prompt is displayed to confirm the deletion and rebuilding of the bin directory
